intro: Visiania glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
